person.subtitle: Focusing on neuro-symbolic interpretability, GNNs, and geometric deep learning
person.description: Exploring the intersection of deep learning, structured knowledge, and symbolic approaches to extraction of understandable concepts from AI systems. Studying responsible approaches to AI development.
about: I am a PhD student at the Intelligent Data Analysis Lab at Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague, supervised by Gustav Šír. I research neuro-symbolic interpretability, graph neural networks, and geometric deep learning; all with the aim to create more trustworthy AI systems. Previously I studied expressivity of GNNs, as well as symmetry-invariant deep learning.
I am currently serving as the president of the Czech Alpha Chapter of Upsilon Pi Epsilon (UPE)

I am passionate about developing AI in a more responsible way. At our department, we started an initiative organizing talks and discussions about the topic of Responsible AI: from AI ethics and fairness to AI safety and alignment. Recently, we also began with our own research agenda, tackling the problem of evaluation of explainable AI techniques from human and regulatory perspectives.
Apart from research, you can also find me developing practical AI solutions based on LLMs (RAG, agents, evals), as well as classical machine learning algorithms.
